title: Marine Vet’s Video About Trump’s Immigration Policy Goes Viral, He’s Then “Evacuated” From His Post
text:
05:58pm February 6, 2017 Do you like this article? 
You may have seen the video of security contractor Steven Gern explaining what he was told when he asked Iraqi’s what would happen to him if tried to walk down the street as an immigrant in an Iraqi town. 
The answer was pretty brutal. 
Now, it looks like he’s no longer welcome at his job now that the video has gone viral. 
From BizPac Review : 
Seen more than 42 million times, Steven Gern explained in the video how an American would be treated in the countries that Trump included in his temporary travel ban. 
“Apparently, it wasn’t safe for me to remain in the location I was in,” he said in a follow up video. “So, I’m being sent out.” 
Here’s the update from Gern. 
Something to think about 
Posted by Steven Gern on Wednesday, February 1, 2017 
Wow. 
Sure looks like the video had something to do with this guy being sent home. 
It’s hard to argue with his overall point that many other countries are far less hospitable to immigrants than we are. 
Mexico has a large fence on the border with Guatemala. Many Middle Eastern countries are not kind to illegal (or legal) immigrants. 
The point is obviously not that we should do what they do but let’s try to keep things in perspective a little bit. 
Clearly, the whole “Muslim ban” narrative from the media was simply a lie. 
Gern raises some interesting questions… LIKE this article?
